The problem here is that the command logging is failing unexpectedly and that 
is causing your keyboard shortcut to not go through.  We should have a work-
around shortly.  Are you running on Windows?  Anything else notable about your 
Eclipse or Java environment?  (This has never occurred before)

Perhaps you using JDK 1.4?  I ask because we just figured out that the XStream 
library we are using can not serialize final fields on JDK 1.4.  Please note 
that Mylar makes extensive use of JDK 1.5 features and **will not run on a 1.4 
VM**.  Note that this does not mean that you have to upgrade your projects to 
1.5, just that you need to run it with a 1.5 VM.

I use MyEclipse IDE.  Also, I use JRockit 1.5.0_02.  Could one of those be
causing the issue?

Also, I noticed that the plugin was installed in the MyEclipse IDE installation
directory, instead of eclipse\plugins.

So the problem seems be an incompatability between the 1.5 JRockit and 
XStream.  I've made Mylar more defensive about this issue and will be emailing 
you with a rev that should solve the shortcuts failing.

The better solution will be to get rid of the Monitor's dependancy on 
XStream.  I've opened bug#102791 for this.

Regarding the installation location issue--that's purely the Eclipse 3.1 
update manager that I don't think we have have control over.  Do you know of 
any other other plugins have a mechanism for installing in eclipse\plugins 
when using MyEclipse?

I tried the new build (labelled 0.3.1) that Mik pointed me to and the keyboard
shortcuts are working now.

The installation location does appear to be a problem with the Update manager. 
I'll investigate that further and file a separate bug if I can figure out what's
going on.
Thanks for your feedback and help Muness!
